Token.Abstract: The main object through which you can interact with PayPal and associated hardware devices such as card readers and chip & pin devices.
The interface to interact with the card reader
The interface to interact with checkin services and merchant locations
The interface to process payments with card swipe, keyed in/scanned, and checkins
A helper to establish OAuth credentials on behalf of your application for a merchant.
A way to do payments & refunds in a stateful way
Should you wish to handle your own network requests, you can set this singleton which the PayPal Here SDK will call whenever a network request needs to go out.

Parameter.Name: delegate
Parameter.Abstract: an object implementing PPHNetworkRequestDelegate which will be in charge of executing requests

Token.Abstract: The current network request delegate.

If you handle your own network requests, you should update the progress of those requests via this method so that various SDK features (such as reader software updates) can report overall progress back to you. This method is meant to allow you to get more precise about progress than is likely possible - so for example you could say a network request consists of connecting, uploading the request info, and downloading (3 totalSteps), and could assign estimated relative durations of each of those to be used in computing the total step units. But for the rest of us mortals, you'll probably just say it's 1 step and the percentage is the percentage of the download that's completed.

Parameter.Name: originalRequest
Parameter.Abstract: The request as originally passed to your network delegate. If you "rewrite" the request, you need to keep the old one around to properly inform us of progress.

Parameter.Name: currentStep
Parameter.Abstract: The 1-based index of the step currently executing (e.g. it doesn't make sense to be on the 0th step.

Parameter.Name: totalSteps
Parameter.Abstract: The count of the total number of steps required to execute the request. Must be at least 1.

Parameter.Name: wholeNumberCurrentPercentage
Parameter.Abstract: a number between 0 and 100 expressing how much of the current step is completed.

Parameter.Name: wholeNumberTotalPercentage
Parameter.Abstract: a number between 0 and 100 expressing how much of the total process is completed.

Token.Abstract: Should you wish to handle your own analytics, you can set this singleton. Be warned if you don't also let us do our own analytics we will not be able to help diagnose aggregate issues for our SDK in your application.

Parameter.Name: delegate
Parameter.Abstract: an object implementing PPHAnalyticsDelegate which will be in charge of reporting events

Token.Abstract: The current analytics delegate.
Should you wish to receive internal log messages, set this delegate. See PPHLogingDelegate for a warning about performance impact.

Parameter.Name: delegate
Parameter.Abstract: an object implementing one or more methods of the PPHLoggingDelegate

Token.Abstract: The current logging delegate or nil.
The currently active merchant account

Set the currently active merchant for which all payment operations will be done. We will persist this merchant information to secure storage. When your app runs again and you call setActiveMerchant with a merchantId we've seen before we'll automatically check the saved merchant info for that merchantId. If you pass in a nil or sparsely filled out merchant object we'll use the values we pulled from storage.

Parameter.Name: merchant
Parameter.Abstract: The merchant information including OAuth credentials

Parameter.Name: merchantId
Parameter.Abstract: a value which we'll use to uniquely identify this merchant on this device so we can save/fetch this specific merchant's information from local secure storage. If more than one merchant logs into this system you should make sure you provide different values. This id belongs to the app and is not generated by paypal nor sent down to the service.

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: The handler to be called when the merchant setup has completed (setup includes a call to the server to verify the token and retrieve user information)

Token.Abstract: Returns YES if we have the access we need to device location information (we ask for significant location changes so long as a transaction is in progress, or for general location updates if the device does not support significant updates).
DEPRECATED Calls "- (void)startWatchingLocation" Returns YES.

Allow the SDK to begin watching the location to attach to payments. In the future allowing the SDK to obtain a location fix will be a requirement for taking payments. Location monitoring is automatically stopped and restarted when the app is suspended if it is being watched.
Disallow the SDK from getting location updates.
For TEST purposes, you can set the service URL used for requests in the PayPal Here SDK

Parameter.Name: url
Parameter.Abstract: The base URL (essentially https://stagename/) for your non-live environment.

Token.Abstract: Used to select between PPHSDKServiceTypes - currently just Live or Sandbox.
The version of the SDK currently in use
The partner referrer code.

Set the Partner Referrer code that is obtained after sigining up with PayPalHere. NOTE: If the value is set in here, it would be automatically set within the invoice. If not, you would need to feed in same the information within the invoice object.

Parameter.Name: referrerCode
Parameter.Abstract: the referrer code that is obtained once a partner registers with PayPalHere.

Token.Abstract: Returns the current base URL
Holds the authoritative state of the card readers and running card data.

This is now the de-facto way to initialize the PPH SDK. The current API - setActiveMerchant - will be marked for deprecation and will be removed at some point in the future. As before, this initialization sequence will ensure that we persist certain merchant information in secure storage. This allows the PPH SDK to re-use this information - such as email id - when such info is not available through our API calls to backend.

Parameter.Name: access_token
Parameter.Abstract: The Access token returned to you from PayPal Access. You will get this after the OAuth flow is completed

Parameter.Name: refresh_url
Parameter.Abstract: Also obtained after the OAuth flow. Once the merchant has authorized your application to make transactions on your behalf you will be able to get the access token and the refresh url from PayPal Access endpoint

Parameter.Name: completionHandler
Parameter.Abstract: The handler that will fire once initialization is done. Your application MUST check the PPHInitResultType to ensure there were no errors.

Parameter.Name: tokenExpiryOrNil
Parameter.Abstract: this is a nice to have and will allow the SDK to predictively pre-fetch a new token when the current token is about to expire. Consider this case: it is possible - although unlikely - that the validity of the access token can expire between the time your application starts a new transaction and the time it actually submits the transaction to PayPal. In this case, we will re-attempt the transaction automatically after refreshing the access token but this extra call will result in a longer time taken and hence a poor user experience. Setting a valid expiry time will help mitigate this scenario

Token.Abstract: Used to select between PPHSDKServiceTypes - currently just Live or Sandbox.
